Type.Name: WebProxy

TypeSignature.Value: .class public serializable WebProxy extends System.Object implements System.Net.IWebProxy

Type.ThreadingSafetyStatement: All public static members of this type are safe for multithreaded operations. No instance members are guaranteed to be thread safe.

summary.para: Contains HTTP proxy settings for the class.

remarks.para: instances use instances to override the proxy settings in .

para.block: Local requests are identified by the lack of a period (.) in the authority of the URI, as in "http://webserver/" versus "http://www.contoso.com/ ".

example.para: The following example sets a for a . The instance uses the proxy to connect to external Internet resources.

summary.para: Gets or sets the address of the proxy server represented by the current instance.

value.para: A containing the address of the proxy server represented by the current instance.

block.para: When is , all requests that reference the current instance bypass the proxy and connect directly to the destination host.

value.para: A of instances. The elements of the list represent the URIs that a instance accesses directly instead of through the proxy server.

MemberSignature.Value: .property bool BypassProxyOnLocal { public hidebysig specialname instance bool get_BypassProxyOnLocal() public hidebysig specialname instance void set_BypassProxyOnLocal(bool value) }
public bool BypassProxyOnLocal { set; get; }

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether requests for local resources bypass the proxy server.

remarks.para: The setting of this property determines whether instances use the proxy server when accessing local resources. If is , requests to local resources do not use the proxy server. Local resources are identified by the lack of a period (.) in the URI, as in "http://webserver/". When is , all requests for resources are made through the proxy server.

para.block: If a request for a resource residing on a local machine is made using a URI that contains a period, the proxy is used to send the request. Create an entity in the to access local resources directly.

public System.Net.ICredentials Credentials { set; get; }

summary.para: Gets or sets the credentials to submit to the proxy server for authentication.

value.para: A object containing the credentials to submit to the proxy server for authentication.

remarks.para: This property contains the authentication credentials to send to the proxy server in response to an HTTP 407 (proxy authorization) status code.

para.block: For more information regarding HTTP status code 407, see .

remarks.para: The default proxy settings of the system are implementation-defined.
